author: Erik Ortiz
description: Four days after the devastating flash floods in Texas Hill Country, local officials and law enforcement in Kerr County couldn’t provide basic details of the emergency response.
title: Texas officials give few answers to growing questions about response to deadly floods

author: The Associated Press
description: The Army announced Tuesday that it's moving toward a future without ceremonial horses and will put most of them up for adoption.
title: Army will end most of its ceremonial horse programs and adopt out the animals

author: The Associated Press
description: A week after an immigration judge granted Mario Guevara bond, the Spanish-language journalist who was arrested while covering a protest last month remains in federal custody.
title: Spanish-language journalist remains in ICE custody despite being granted bond

author: Tom Winter
description: Top officials at the New York City police department doled out prized promotions to unqualified "friends and cronies," according to a new lawsuit.
title: Former top NYPD officials accused of giving promotions to 'friends and cronies'

author: Minyvonne Burke
description: The Hunt Store, the 'hub' of small Kerr County town, feeds locals from a demolished storefront after the Texas floods.
title: The 'hub' of a tiny Kerr County town feeds locals from a demolished storefront

author: Ben Goggin
description: Elon Musk's Grok made several antisemitic posts on X days after the tech billionaire released an updated version of the AI chatbot.
title: Elon Musk’s AI chatbot churns out antisemitic posts days after update

author: Aria Bendix
description: Mystic camper Lucy Kennedy and her mother, Wynne Kennedy, told NBC News of Lucy's harrowing escape and the destruction they've seen from the Texas floods.
title: Camper evacuated from Texas flood recalls harrowing hours at Camp Mystic

description: NBC News’ Morgan Chesky speaks with a young camper who survived catastrophic flooding at Camp Mystic and has a message for grieving families.
title: Girl details Camp Mystic evacuation during catastrophic Texas flooding

author: The Associated Press
description: NEW YORK (AP) — Amazon is extending its annual Prime Day sales and offering new membership perks to Gen Z shoppers amid tariff-related price worries and possibly some consumer boredom with an event marking its 11th year
title: Amazon extends Prime Day discounts to 4 days as retailers weigh tariffs and price increases

author: The Politics Desk
description: As it made its way through Congress, the "One Big Beautiful Bill Act" received consistently low marks from the public. This has fed Democratic optimism as the 2026 midterm playing field begins to take shape.
title: With their megabill signed into law, Republicans seek to buck midterm history

author: Lawrence Hurley
description: The administration had asked the court to step in after a judge in California blocked its plans for reductions in force and to reorganize a swath of departments and agencies.
title: Supreme Court allows Trump to move forward with mass firings at federal agencies

author: Reuters
description: WASHINGTON, (Reuters) - U.S. President Donald Trump’s latest tariff delay provided some hope to major trade partners Japan, South Korea and the European Union that deals to ease duties could still be reached, while bewildering some smaller exporters such as South Africa and leaving companies with no clarity on the path forward
title: Trump's tariff deadline delay brings hope, confusion to trade partners, businesses

author: Leslie Josephs, CNBC
description: Boeing delivered 60 airplanes last month, the most since December 2023, as the plane maker seeks to raise production of its bestselling 737 Max jets after a series of manufacturing and safety problems
title: Boeing delivers most airplanes since late 2023 after ramping up 737 Max output

author: Kevin Collier
description: An unknown individual or group using AI impersonated Secretary of State Marco Rubio to contact at least five high-level government, according to a State Department cable.
title: An AI voice impersonated Marco Rubio in messages to high-level officials, State Department says

author: Jennifer Elias, CNBC
description: Waymo announced Tuesday that it is offering accounts for teens ages 14 to 17, starting in Phoenix
title: Waymo offers teen accounts for driverless rides

author: The Associated Press
description: The revelation was contained in court filings Monday by lawyers for more than 100 migrants who are seeking to challenge their deportations to CECOT, El Salvador’s mega-prison.
title: Migrants deported to El Salvador prison remain under U.S. control, Salvadoran officials tell UN

author: Michael Ozanian, CNBC
description: As team values rise — highlighted by the record $6.1 billion sale of the NBA’s Boston Celtics — sports empires are thriving.
title: CNBC's most valuable sports empires 2025: Kroenke Sports & Entertainment tops list

author: Katherine Doyle
description: President Donald Trump expressed mounting frustration Tuesday with Russian President Vladimir Putin, promising during a lively Cabinet meeting to boost U.S. military aid to Ukraine.“We get a lot of bull--- thrown at us by Putin, if you want to know the truth,” Trump told reporters, who attended a nearly two-hour stretch of the meeting.
title: Trump unloads on Putin after promising more military aid to Ukraine

author: Kevin Breuninger, CNBC
description: President Donald Trump said he will impose a 50% tariff on copper imports on Tuesday, and suggested more steep sector-specific duties are on the way.“Today, we’re doing copper,” Trump said during a Cabinet meeting at the White House.
title: Trump says he will impose 50% tariff on copper imports

author: Kimmy Yam
description: A group of immigrants with temporary legal status in the U.S. is suing the Trump administration after the Department of Homeland Security terminated the legal protections for some 60,000 people from Nicaragua, Honduras and Nepal.
title: Trump administration sued after it ends program for 60,000 Hondurans, Nicaraguans and Nepalese

author: The Associated Press
description: Many Mexicans say they've been priced out of their neighborhoods; and critics blame government policies, including ones to attract digital nomads.
title: Mexico march against tourism is 'xenophobic,' president says

author: Chloe Atkins
description: A federal judge on Monday temporarily blocked the Trump administration from barring Medicaid funding for Planned Parenthood under a provision of the Republicans' sweeping tax and spending package.
title: Judge temporarily blocks Trump administration from cutting off Planned Parenthood funding

author: Evan Bush
description: Modern weather forecasts have never been so accurate, but they still have their limits.
title: In Texas, cutting-edge weather forecasts hit their limits as Trump budget cuts loom

author: Gary Grumbach
description: The Internal Revenue Service agreed in a court filing that churches can endorse political candidates without fear of losing their tax-exempt status
title: IRS says churches can endorse political candidates without losing tax exemptions

author: Shannon Pettypiece
description: A provision tucked inside a sweeping bill signed into law by Trump last week will make it harder for aspiring doctors to finance their education as the country faces a growing shortage in that profession.
title: Medical students fret over the new student loan cap in the 'big, beautiful bill'

author: Doha Madani
description: A Detroit man who made headlines for his Liberace-inspired home years ago is now accused of setting fire to the ornate residence.
title: Detroit man accused of setting fire to his Liberace-inspired home

author: The Associated Press
description: Social justice advocates are creating a queer history archive that celebrates Bayard Rustin, a major organizer in the Civil Rights Movement and key architect of the March on Washington
title: A Bayard Rustin archive aims to preserve his legacy as a queer Civil Rights activist

author: The Associated Press
description: A malfunction with Wimbledon 's new electronic line-calling system required a point to be replayed during a quarterfinal match between Taylor Fritz and Karen Khachanov on Tuesday.
title: Wimbledon's new electric line-calling system malfunctions during quarterfinals

author: Rob Wile
description: Trump said Tuesday there would be “no extensions” granted to the new August 1 deadline for U.S. trading partners to negotiate new deals or face higher tariffs on goods imported from their countries.
title: Trump threatens 'no extensions' on Aug. 1 tariff deadline and warns of higher duties

author: Astha Rajvanshi
description: "A Quest for Justice" includes eyewitness testimony from at least 17 different incidents of sexual assault, as well as accounts from first responders and other evidence.
title: New Israeli report says Hamas used sexual violence as a 'weapon of war' in Oct. 7 attack

author: Reuters
description: The action, effective on September 6, will end Temporary Protected Status for about 72,000 Hondurans and 4,000 Nicaraguans; the State Department warns of travel to the 2 countries.
title: Trump ending deportation protections for thousands of Hondurans and Nicaraguans

author: The Associated Press
description: The Wisconsin Supreme Court cleared the way Tuesday for the state to institute a ban on conversion therapy in a ruling that gives the governor more power over how state laws are enacted.
title: Wisconsin Supreme Court clears the way for a conversion therapy ban to be enacted

description: Former Camp Mystic campers and counselors gather in Houston for a vigil honoring the lives lost in the July 4th flood. KPRC's Corey Peel reports.
title: 'Mystic made me who I am': Camp alumni honor flood victims

author: The Associated Press
description: Spanish police believe Liverpool player Diogo Jota was driving over the speed limit when he and his brother died in a car crash last week.
title: Liverpool soccer star was driving above the speed limit when he crashed, Spanish police believe

author: David K. Li
description: Police in Turks and Caicos found the body of a man amid an ongoing search for an American reported missing nearby almost two weeks earlier, local authorities said over the weekend
title: Body found in Turks & Caicos amid search for missing American man, local police say

author: Chloe Atkins
description: The Department of Justice filed a criminal complaint on Monday against 10 people who allegedly "organized an ambush" at an ICE detention center in Texas on the Fourth of July.
title: 10 charged after ambush at Texas ICE detention center

author: The Associated Press
description: Barnard College has settled a lawsuit that accused the college of not doing enough to combat antisemitism on campus.
title: Barnard College settles lawsuit accusing school of not doing enough to fight antisemitism

author: Reuters
description: Education Secretary Linda McMahon threatened California with legal action after the state refused to ban trans girls from participating in girls’ sports.
title: Education Sec. threatens California with legal action over transgender sports law

description: Watch live coverage as President Trump meets with his Cabinet at the White House. The meeting comes after the passage of the "One Big Beautiful Bill," ongoing international trade talks and recovery efforts in Texas from the deadly floods.
title: Trump holds Cabinet meeting

author: Alexander Smith
description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and President Donald Trump discussed at the White House controversial plans to relocate Palestinians out of Gaza.
title: Trump-Netanyahu meeting revives bitterly opposed plan to relocate Palestinians

description: Search and rescue efforts continued in Texas after catastrophic floods killed at least 104 people across six counties. NBC News' Jay Gray reports from Kerrville, Texas, where dozens are still missing.
title: Search and recovery efforts continue in Texas after devastating floods

description: As communities continue to honor the lives lost after the devastating floods in Texas, locals and leaders in the region say lives could have been saved if there were sirens to alert people in the path of destruction. NBC’s Ryan Chandler reports for TODAY.
title: Could Warning Sirens Have Saved Lives in Texas Flooding?

author: Lindsey Leake
description: If your exercise routine has hit a summer slump, it may be because your workouts aren’t suited to your personality, new research suggests
title: Want better workout results? Match your exercise to your personality, study suggests

author: Aria Bendix
description: Measles cases in the United States are the highest they’ve been since the country eliminated the disease in 2000.
title: Measles cases reach highest point since the disease was eliminated from U.S. in 2000

description: The TSA appears ready to end a rule that requires airline travelers to remove their shoes for security screenings thanks to the advancement of new technology. The requirement has been in place since 2006 when Richard Reid tried detonating an explosive in his shoes while on a flight from Paris to Miami. NBC’s Tom Costello breaks down the changes for TODAY.
title: TSA Moves to End Shoes-Off Policy After 20 Years

description: President Donald Trump says the window for countries to negotiate new trade deals with the United States to avoid a spike in tariffs is all but closed with one day to go before the 90-day deadline to strike a deal or face “reciprocal tariffs.” It comes as he imposes new import rates on 14 countries up to 40%. NBC’s Garrett Haake reports for TODAY.
title: Trump Extends His Tariff Deadline as He Threatens More Dues

author: Jay Blackman
description: It’s now OK to keep your shoes on at some airports
title: TSA to end shoe removal policy at some airport security checkpoints, government source says

author: Mithil Aggarwal
description: Chinese state media warned the Trump administration against striking deals that sideline China, after the president announced that Asian countries would face higher tariffs starting on Aug. 1.
title: China says it will retaliate on unfavorable deals after Trump warns Asia of higher tariffs

author: Elizabeth Robinson
description: A look at one Texas city’s weather warning system, as questions swirl about the timing of flash flood warnings.
title: Scrutiny over Texas flood alerts and conservative anger after Epstein memo release: Morning Rundown

author: Reuters
description: The tale of a middle-aged man, or “uncle,” who disguised himself as a woman to secretly film videos of his hookups withmen, shook China’s social media.
title: Lurid tale of cross-dressing 'red uncle' goes viral in China

author: The Associated Press
description: Five years after the true crime documentary “Tiger King” captivated a country shut down by COVID-19, the final legal troubles for one of its main characters will be resolved Tuesday in a courtroom in South Carolina
title: Latest 'Tiger King' twist finds 'Doc' Antle facing possible prison sentence for animal trafficking

author: The Associated Press
description: Haiti's once-illustrious Grand Hôtel Oloffson, a beloved Gothic gingerbread home that inspired books, and attracted famous visitor was burned down by gangs.
title: Gangs in Haiti burn beloved Gothic gingerbread hotel that rose to international fame

author: The Associated Press
description: French President Emmanuel Macron arrives in Britain on Tuesday for a state visit mixing royal pageantry with thorny political talks about stopping migrants from crossing the English Channel in small boats.
title: France's Macron makes a state visit to the U.K. with migration and Ukraine on the agenda

author: Bridget Bowman
description: Independent Dan Osborn launched another run for the Senate in Nebraska on Tuesday after having waged a surprisingly competitive, though ultimately unsuccessful, campaign last year.
title: Independent Dan Osborn launches another Nebraska Senate run

author: The Associated Press
description: The Trump administration is revoking the terrorism designation of a group led by Syria’s new president as part of a broader U.S. engagement with the transitional government since the ouster of former leader Bashar Assad late last year.
title: Trump administration revokes terrorism designation of new Syrian leader’s group

author: Zoe Malin
description: Amazon Prime Day, aka the biggest sale of the year so far, is officially here.
title: Live updates: 29+ actually good deals worth buying on Prime Day

author: The Associated Press
description: Federal officers and National Guard troops fanned out around a mostly empty Los Angeles park in a largely immigrant neighborhood on foot, horseback and military vehicles on Monday for about an hour before abruptly leaving, an operation that local officials said seemed designed to sow fear.
title: Troops and federal agents briefly descend on LA's MacArthur Park in largely immigrant neighborhood

author: Zoe Malin
description: These are the absolute best Amazon Prime Day deals worth your money from Apple, Dyson, Olaplex Bissell, Kindle, iRobot and more — updated live.
title: Live updates: 39+ actually good deals worth buying on Prime Day

author: Adrienne Broaddus
description: Sen. John Hoffman, who, along with his wife, was among the first victims in a June shooting spree that took the life of a fellow lawmaker was released from intensive care.
title: Minnesota state senator wounded in deadly political shootings is out of intensive care

description: NBC News’ Morgan Chesky speaks to his mom about her experience during the devastating floods that overtook their hometown of Kerrville, Texas, over the weekend.
title: Morgan Chesky’s mom recounts ‘surreal feeling’ of catastrophic Texas flooding

author: Jon Schuppe
description: Officials in Texas Hill Country are starting to focus on alert systems like the one in Comfort as they search for answers on how the flash flooding swept away so many in Kerrville.
title: In deadly Texas floods, one town had what some didn't: A wailing warning siren
